name: Hiran Gunawardana
bio: With over 15 years of coaching excellence in Sri Lanka and the UAE, Hiran has built a reputation for transforming teams and producing top-performing players. Renowned for his technical mastery and player development skills, he continues to inspire cricketers to reach their highest potential.
qualificationDescription: Hiran’s internationally recognized qualifications highlight his strong technical foundation and commitment to elite coaching standards.
experienceDescription: With an extensive coaching career across top Sri Lankan schools and clubs, Hiran has consistently developed skilled players and competitive teams.
experience: Head Coach - Old Anthony’s Cricket Club, Sri Lanka (2022, Div 1)
Head Coach Junior Cricket - Dharmapala College, Sri Lanka (2018–2019)
Head Coach - St. Johns College, Sri Lanka (2015–2017)
achievementDescription: Hiran’s cricketing achievements reflect a remarkable playing career, marked by consistency, excellence, and national-level recognition.
achievements: Nalanda College 1999–2000 Best Batsman / Colours Man
1000+ runs in two Sri Lankan Div 1 College Cricket seasons consecutively (1997–1998)
specializationDescription: He is highly respected for his ability to develop complete cricketers through technical, tactical, and high-performance player development.

name: Himasha Kumarage
qualificationDescription: Her strong coaching and umpiring certifications reflect a well-rounded understanding of cricket and the discipline required to guide young athletes.
experienceDescription: With several years of coaching experience in the UAE, she has played a vital role in nurturing emerging female and junior cricketers.
experience: 3 years of experience with Freedem Cricket Academy UAE
achievementDescription: Her skill and dedication earned her a place in the UAE National Development Squad, showcasing her capability both as a player and leader.
achievements: Represented the UAE National Development Squad
specializationDescription: She excels in developing young cricketers, especially girls, with a focus on building fundamentals, discipline, and match awareness.

name: Prajeev Jansze
qualificationDescription: Prajeev’s multi-level certifications from BCCSL and ICC demonstrate his strong technical background and commitment to continuous growth.
experienceDescription: With over 14 years of international coaching experience across Sri Lanka, New Zealand, Qatar, and UAE, he brings global exposure and deep cricketing insight.
experience: 14+ years of coaching across Sri Lanka, New Zealand, Qatar, and UAE
Has coached players at academy, school, and competitive levels
achievementDescription: He has contributed to multiple championship-winning teams, earning recognition in both domestic and international tournaments.
achievements: New Zealand: Hazlett Trophy Champions (2012) – Wellington
specializationDescription: Prajeev is known for refining batting techniques, building strong mental discipline, and preparing players for high-pressure competitive cricket.

name: Gihan Lakshitha
experienceDescription: Gihan has supported school cricket programs by helping young players strengthen their basics and build confidence on the field.
experience: 6 months coaching at Anula Vidyalaya, Nugegoda
6 months coaching at Lumbini College, Colombo 05
achievementDescription: His dedication and performance as a school cricketer earned him the prestigious School Colours award.
specializationDescription: He focuses on guiding beginner cricketers and shaping strong fundamental skills in batting, bowling, and fielding.

name: Anuhas Dasanayaka
qualificationDescription: Anuhas has achieved respected ICC coaching certification, showcasing his technical understanding and commitment to player development.
experienceDescription: With several years of coaching experience, he brings energy, discipline, and modern training methods to his players.
specializationDescription: He specializes in sharpening technical skills, improving fitness, and developing mentally strong and performance-ready athletes.
